definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: Instead, the social and demographic aspects of farming, ratherthan its productivity, may have been essential to its emergence and spread.
sentences.chinese: 農業興起與傳播的關鍵在於社會與人口學方面的優勢。

sentences.english: Who are the other important demographic players?
sentences.chinese: 誰又是處於次重要地位的人口學參與者呢？

sentences.english: Many developing countries are enjoying demographic changes.
sentences.chinese: 許多發展中國家正在經受人口學的變化。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the related demographic and obstetrical factors of postpartum depressive symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討與產後抑鬱症相關的人口學因素及產科因素。

sentences.english: Demography, though, is not only about economics.
sentences.chinese: 不過，人口學不僅僅只包括經濟層面。

sentences.english: Multivariable regression analysis was performed to identify demographic predictors of tobacco use.
sentences.chinese: 開展了多元迴歸分析，用以確定吸菸的人口學預測值。

sentences.english: Correlation analysis of migrant workers' socio-demographic features and health status was conducted.
sentences.chinese: 社會人口學特徵與農民工健康的相關分析。

sentences.english: Because this is a demographic that has traditionally been overlooked by demographers.
sentences.chinese: 因爲這一部分人口一直以來都被人口學家忽略。

sentences.english: Demographers in America enjoy pointing out that China also will become an aging society over time.
sentences.chinese: 美國的人口學家樂於指出中國人口也正逐漸老齡化。
